metadata.unit_designation: Xxi Corpo D Armata Xxi Corps
metadata.commander_name: Generale di Corpo d'Armata Lorenzo Dalmazzo (until 26 Sept 1940), then Carlo Spatocco (26 Sept - 20 Dec 1940)

narrative.title: Xxi Corpo D Armata Xxi Corps - 1940Q4
narrative.situation: Italian Army Corps deployed in North Africa during 1940Q4.
narrative.objectives: Reserve corps for 10th Army. Positioned at Tobruk/Sofafi to support forward divisions at Sidi Barrani. NOT committed to isolated fortified camps that were destroyed in Operation Compass opening.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain and rocky desert (Cyrenaica/Tobruk region)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Reserve status - better supplied than forward corps
Positioned at Tobruk port - direct access to sea supply route
Mixed metropolitan (Cirene) and Blackshirt militia divisions

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain and rocky desert (Cyrenaica/Tobruk region)
